heroSection.title: The Muslim Students' Association of Dalhousie University
heroSection.subtitle: A Service of the Students' Community at Dalhousie University
heroSection.bismillahTranslation: In the Name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful

welcomeMessage.heading: Assalamu Alaykum! Peace be upon you!
welcomeMessage.description: Welcome to the official website of the Muslim Students' Association of Dalhousie University! We are a student-run service at Dalhousie University that brings together Muslim students to provide resources, essential services, and educational tools needed to enhance their university experience. We aim to facilitate the spiritual and social growth of our community, as well as the larger Dalhousie community, supporting diverse student needs, inShaAllah!

insights.title: Prayer Map & Times
insights.description: Discover prayer spaces and prayer times across campus.

insights.title: Chaplaincy Program
insights.description: Offering spiritual and mental support through our chaplaincy program.

insights.title: Community Engagement
insights.description: Join our social events and community activities to connect.

timeline.title: Winter Orientation
timeline.description: In this event, the students will get to know about the MSA as well as learn how life is for Muslim students here in Halifax.

timeline.title: Quran Tafseer Halaqah
timeline.description: These Halaqahs take place every Monday and Friday to get a better understanding of the Quran.

timeline.title: Badminton/Basketball
timeline.description: These game sessions will be held during the weekends for the students to have fun and socialize with others.

timeline.title: Back to School Party
timeline.description: In this event, students got the chance to meet fellow Muslim students in Halifax and make connections. We also hosted a Basketball tournament to create engagement.

timeline.title: Dal Helpers
timeline.description: These are senior university students who would hold one-on-one sessions with junior students to help them out in their academics.

upcoming.title: Ramadan Iftar
upcoming.description: Join us for a community Iftar to break the fast together.

upcoming.title: Eid Celebration
upcoming.description: Celebrate Eid with us through prayers, food, and festivities.

past.title: Weekly Halaqas
past.description: Join our weekly halaqas for religious knowledge gatherings.

past.title: Charity Fundraiser
past.description: Participate in our charity fundraiser to support local communities.

sections.title: Prayer Times
sections.description: Prayer times are calculated based on the latitude and longitude of the Killam Memorial Library at Dalhousie University, Halifax.

jumuah.note: Subject to change, please check regularly for updates.

events: Eid al Fitr & Eid al Adha celebrations
